newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to issue 7.64 trln won gov't bonds in '97.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to issue 7.64 trln won gov't bonds in '97.

text.p: South Korean government will issue 7.64 trillion won worth of government bonds in 1997, against an estimated 8.87 trillion issued this year, a central Bank of Korea statement said on Friday.

The bank said in a statement it planned to redeem 4.82 trillion won worth of government bonds in 1997, which would result in a net of 2.82 trillion won worth of government bonds offered on the money market.

Of the total new government bond issues, 28.8 percent would be short-term bonds, which include three months, six months and one year, 41.9 percent would be mid-term, including three and five-year bonds, and the rest would be long-term, including seven-year, 10-year and 20-year ones, it said.

The central bank said 1.98 trillion won worth of government bonds are scheduled to be issued in the first quarter, 1.86 trillion in the second quarter, 1.44 trillion in the third quarter and 2.36 trillion in the last quarter.

South Korean government bonds are not offered to foreign investors, said an official at the central bank. There are currently no concrete plans to open the government bond market to foreigners, he added.
